labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on downloading videos from Instagram, offering a simple and lightweight solution for users to fetch and manage video downloads. The core functionality revolves around web automation for media retrieval, with additional features for tracking and managing local storage paths of downloaded content.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Social Media" is chosen because the tool directly interacts with a social media platform (Instagram) to fetch and manage media content. The secondary label "File Management" is added because the server handles local storage and organization of downloaded files. "Browser Automation" could also be considered due to the web interaction aspect, but "Social Media" more directly reflects the core use case.

server_info_crawled.name: Instagram Video Downloader
server_info_crawled.author: @handoing/ig-download-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Fetch and download Instagram videos effortlessly. Track progress and manage downloads to your local path with ease. Integrate seamlessly with your applications using this lightweight MCP service.
server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@handoing/ig-download-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
